body.p:
To his Excellency Thos E Bramlett
Governor of Kentucky

Your Petitioner John T Strode respectfully represents that James W Duckworth was Indicted by the Grand Jury of Clark County Kentucky upon the charge of carrying conceald weapons- said case as he believes was continued for several terms by the Commonwealth-and Duckworth as he further believes being ready for trial and very confident of success, upon the ground of being able to show an entire justification for carrying the weapons- until finaly at the November Term 1863 of said Court- the said Duckworth was not present, being within the Confederate lines- the Recognizance bond given by him in the Penalty of $100= in which your Petitioner was surety was declared Forfeited- and at the May Term 1863 of said Court Judgment was rendered thereon in favor of the Commonwealth and against this Petitioner- The said Duckworth is without Estate, and your Petitioner, limited means are such that he earnestly solicits your Excellency for remit a Remission of said Judgment, Your Petitioner knew that Duckworth was justified in carrying the weapon ^in proper self defence^ & was sure of ^his^ being acquitted on the trial of the case
John T Strode
Clark County Ky
John T Strode says he beleaives the forgoing Petition to be true
John T Strode
to before me this ay of March 1864-
E. T. Taylor P. J. C. C. C.

Clark Cir Ct
vs
J. T. Strode
Forfeited
$100 --
13th May/64

I cordialy recommend the case of Mr Strode to the favorable consideration of the Governor He is a clever promising young Physician just beginning life & the judgment is oppression on him. He is a very worthy & truthful young gentleman. Let off this fine & you will do a neighborly deed

yours &c
Jno B Huston

Winchester April 7th 1864
Governor Bramlette
Sir
The Petitioner Dr John M Strode is a very clever gentleman, and has always been an orderly, sober, & quiet citizen.
I have no doubt but the accompaning statements are true, & hope it is compatible with your duty to remit his fine
I am sir with every expression of confidence & respect your obt servt

Af Allan
Sam G Stuart
I am well acquainted with Doctor Strode have heard the case and say that I believe He ought to be released from the payment of the forfeiture
Jas G Bush
I fully concur with Dr Allan_Mr Stuart Judge Bush and Genl Huston. the request and propriety of remitting the judgment against Dr Strode, and hope he may be released
Chas Eginton
